education.val: Donbas State Technical University (computer engineer, bachelor degree) [09.2012 — 06.2016]

list.name: Javascript [ES2016]
list.descr:
Nowadays I work actively with vanilla ES2016, Knockout, React/Redux. I write a lot of pet-projects on React/Redux.

As many developers I have my own boilerplate for Webpack+Babel+React+Redux. You can find it by the following link:
https://github.com/fnnzzz/fnnzzz-react-redux-boilerplate

For non-SPA apps I use gulp & my setup for him, that had repeatedly rescued me. You can find it by the following link:
https://github.com/fnnzzz/fnnzzz-gulp-config

Since recent times, I have been developing on Angular 6 for commercial development

list.name: SASS (CSS preprocessing)
list.descr:
I develop on SASS according to the BEM methodology (it refers only to the names of the classes). Besides that, I actively use Bourbon framework that contains a lot of useful mixins simplifying life. As a responsive grid, I often use Neat from Bourbon’s developers.

I recently use css-modules & enjoy life

list.name: Jade/Pug/Mustache/Handlebars
list.descr: Love when HTML code looks cleaner & more readable.

list.name: CI/CD
list.descr: Worked with docker + k8s, jenkins pipelines, bitbucket pipelines.

list.name: MySQL
list.descr: I have experience in websites development with individual structure of relational DB. Please find my diploma work by the following link: http://diplom-feninets.esy.es/index.php/requests All the DB is organized via relational connections. You can find the presentation to my diploma work by the following link: https://fnnzzz.github.io/diploma-presentation/

list.name: NoSQL
list.descr: I tried to use Elastic/MongoDB for pet-projects

list.name: PHP
list.descr: I had experience on websites development on native PHP, using different MVC frameworks (ex. Codelgniter), on WordPress etc.

list.name: Python
list.descr: I often write simple scripts in Python. Also, I wrote several websites in Django. You can find one of them by the following link, I did front-end as well as back-end: http://guerlain.ua/

list.name: C#
list.descr: During second & third years of studying at the university I was writing many desktop (WPF) and console apps

list.name: Java
list.descr: I have developed one desktop app & 2 apps for Android.

list.name: rabota.ua
list.descr: For current moment I have been working at jobseeker-team. I have developed a lot on vanilla-js, implement react+redux for new features (to tell the truth we have more preact in production). As well all company has certain amount of legacy, that step by step is re-implementing on React, we have also several big projects that require support on Knockout. We have implemented big project totally on Angular 5 in January 2018 - m.rabota.ua and this is interesting experience, as with ng+rx, so and high-load things, similar to docker & k8s.

list.name: ITVDN [part-time]
list.descr:
In parallel with the main job (I mean part-time) I was involved with the React+Redux courses development on ITVDN platform. As for me, it was very interesting & challenging experience, but to repeat something like this I am not going to in the nearest future :)
You can watch by the following link - ITVDN and YouTube (promo cropped video)

list.name: pickoose.com
list.descr: Startup, I had come there to re-develop the existing front-end from angular v1 to React + Redux + Restful eco-system. I got interesting experience that was connected with the internal messenger development during almost 2 months. It was fun with debounce/throttling for mark viewed messages, keep unsent messages in LocalStorage etc. Unfortunatelly, startup did not receive investments in 2 months & that is why I had to look for a new job.

list.name: Lazard Export
list.descr: Here I had come <s>to God</s> to Webpack + React + Redux. I had develoved dashboard to IoT project with the help of which the control had been monitored (device was on raspberry pi, leaded with the help of RESTful)

list.name: ITCG
list.descr: Development of promo and langing pages. Mostly they were vanilla JS & a lot of jQuery-spagetti. Althought had to be fullstack & implemented the whole project from ground zero (back-end + front-end). Back-end, by the way, was implemented in Python (django). On top of all that, this project is still in production: http://guerlain.ua/

list.name: Freelance
list.descr:
We had two bags of wordpress, seventy-five pellets of free html5 templates...
Not that we needed all that for the freelance, but once you get locked into a serious web-sites collection, the tendency is to push it as far as you can ©
